00002 =                                                                           =

00016 
00017 #include "MisrReadData.h"
00018 #include "MisrProjParam.h"
00019 #include "MisrMapQuery.h"
00020 #include "MisrCoordQuery.h"
00021 #include "MisrUtil.h"
00022 #include "MisrError.h"
00023 
00048 MTKt_status MtkCreateLatLon(
00049   MTKt_MapInfo mapinfo,     
00050   MTKt_DataBuffer *latbuf,  
00051   MTKt_DataBuffer *lonbuf    )
00052 {
00053   MTKt_status status;       /* Return status */
00054   MTKt_status status_code;  /* Return status code for error macros */
00055   MTKt_DataBuffer lat = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT;
00056                                 /* Latitude data buffer structure */
00057   MTKt_DataBuffer lon = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT;
00058                                 /* Longitude data buffer structure */
00059   float line;           /* Data plane line index */
00060   float sample;         /* Data plane sample index */
00061   double somx;          /* SOM X */
00062   double somy;          /* SOM Y */
00063   int b;                        /* Block index */
00064   int l;                        /* Block line index */
00065   int s;                        /* Block sample index */
00066   int lp;                       /* Data plane integer line index */
00067   int sp;                       /* Data plane integer sample index */
00068 
00069   /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00070   /* Allocate buffers of the latitude and longitude data */
00071   /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00072 
00073   status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(mapinfo.nline, mapinfo.nsample,
00074                  MTKe_double, &lat);
00075   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00076   status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(mapinfo.nline, mapinfo.nsample,
00077                  MTKe_double, &lon);
00078   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00079 
00080   /* ------------------------------ */
00081   /* Fill with a default fill value */
00082   /* ------------------------------ */
00083 
00084   for (l = 0; l < mapinfo.nline; l++) {
00085     for (s = 0; s < mapinfo.nsample; s++) {
00086       lat.data.d[l][s] = -200.0;
00087       lon.data.d[l][s] = -200.0;
00088     }
00089   }
00090 
00091   /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00092   /* Compute the lat/lon for each block/line/sample in the swath     */
00093   /* that intersect with the data plane defined my mapinfo           */
00094   /* --------------------------------------------------------------- */
00095 
00096   for (b = mapinfo.start_block; b <= mapinfo.end_block; b++) {
00097     for (l = 0; l < mapinfo.pp.nline; l++) {
00098       for (s = 0; s < mapinfo.pp.nsample; s++) {
00099     MtkBlsToSomXY(mapinfo.path, mapinfo.resolution, b, (float)l, (float)s,
00100               &somx, &somy);
00101     MtkSomXYToLS(mapinfo, somx, somy, &line, &sample);
00102     lp = (int)line;
00103     sp = (int)sample;
00104     if (lp >= 0 && lp < mapinfo.nline &&
00105         sp >= 0 && sp < mapinfo.nsample) {
00106       MtkSomXYToLatLon(mapinfo.path, somx, somy, 
00107                &(lat.data.d[lp][sp]), &(lon.data.d[lp][sp]));
00108     }
00109       }
00110     }
00111   }
00112 
00113   *latbuf = lat;
00114   *lonbuf = lon;
00115 
00116   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00117  ERROR_HANDLE:
00118   MtkDataBufferFree(&lat);
00119   MtkDataBufferFree(&lon);
00120   return status_code;
00121 }
